New Records: Anthony Volpe became the first player in World Series history with a grand slam and a pair of stolen bases in one game
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe's grand slam sparked the Yankees to an 11-4 win over the Los Angeles Dodgers
Freddie Freeman hit another first-inning home run
Freddie Freeman became the first player to homer in the first four games of a World Series
Wells hit a second-deck homer in the sixth
Torres' three-run homer off Brent Honeywell in the eighth
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Dave Roberts said he feels good about the Dodgers' chances in Game 5
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in a sellout crowd of 49,354
Fans in the crowd chanted Volpe's name during the ninth inning
Volpe was interviewed after the game by former Yankees captain Derek Jeter
